{"step_by_step_thinking": "To determine which of the options is not a proof of inhalation burns, we need to understand the signs and symptoms of inhalation burns. Inhalation burns can cause various respiratory symptoms such as hoarseness, stridor, coughing, wheezing, and difficulty breathing. It can also lead to the deposition of blackish soot on the posterior part of the tongue due to the inhalation of smoke and soot particles. Additionally, inhalation burns can cause damage to the airways and respiratory tract, leading to the production of yellow or greenish sputum. Singeing of eyebrows and facial hair can also be a sign of inhalation burns as it indicates exposure to heat and flames. Therefore, the option that is not a proof of inhalation burns is A. Yellow colored sputum.", "answer_choice": "A"}
